history.content:
Yes, you can overlap two upper division courses between each major. For a triple major, that means up to 6 courses can be double counted (two between each major pair).

Source: contemplating a triple major and asked the same question to drop in advising in dwinelle.

I'm looking into doing majors in LSCS, Stats, and Econ, but I'm not exactly sure how using one course to satisfy multiple requirements works. For the stats major, you are required to have 3 cluster courses. On the EECS requirements site, I believe it says you may overlap up to 2 courses, so could I simultaneously satisfy 2 cluster courses in stats with 2 classes that are also being used to count towards my required 20 upper division technical units for LSCS? Could I then satisfy the remaining necessary cluster course with an approved Econ course that also counts for my Econ requirements? Thanks for any help.
history.subject: How does overlapping courses between majors work?
